elements.title: David Kushner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David Kushner (pictured) based his song "Daylight" on biblical references that inspired him as a child?

elements.title: a Florida public TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that volunteers at a Florida public TV station forced its chief fundraiser to resign by accosting him in the hallway?

elements.title: Muhammad Ismail (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during his tenure as Governor of Central Java, Muhammad Ismail banned rock music concerts and car rallies?

elements.title: drone congregation areas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that no one knows how honeybee drones from hundreds of different colonies all converge on the same drone congregation areas to mate?

elements.title: James Tissot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that James Tissot is thought to have transgressed many Victorian sexual boundaries in his work, even setting a painting aboard the HMS Calcutta as a pun on a female subject's behind?

elements.title: Eden Detention Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in March 1991, hundreds of inmates rioted at the Eden Detention Center over a lack of vegetables on the cafeteria menu, causing an estimated US$250,000 in damages?

elements.title: Shigi Qutuqu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shigi Qutuqu, a high-ranking official during the early Mongol Empire, survived the first four Mongol khans when he died over the age of eighty?

elements.title: Flu Game shoes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that on June 14, 2023, Michael Jordan's Flu Game shoes sold for US$1.38 million?
